(3/6) I did my part and got my #CovidVaccine. Because I deeply believe in the benefit that vaccines provide to society and disadvantaged populations.
(1/6) Today‚Äôs #SundaySpotlight will focus on the new #CovidVaccines. Vaccines are CRITICAL in winning the fight against #COVID19.

Touring the @EskenaziHealth #covid19 vax station, I feel great hope. When people see the finish line of a marathon, nobody stops. We have to run strong for the last few miles at the beginning of the end. We have a tool to end the pandemic, but we must continue to stay vigilant! https://t.co/ktqTA4AMIK

Good morning from #Indianapolis! Kicked off the day meeting w/ folks from my old stomping grounds @EskenaziHealth to discuss their #COVID19 mitigation measures & best practices. Proud of my old hospital & the work they are doing on the front lines of the pandemic üí™üèæ https://t.co/4tz1DbXynf

It's important to help those feeling socially isolated. While we are physically separate due to #COVID19, we can still find ways to connect. See @ACLgov Lance Robertson‚Äôs blog for ideas to connect safely & #CommitToConnect to others this holiday season https://t.co/cBJpreshIA

It's important we take #COVID19 seriously. Your actions can have an impact on your family and community in ways you may not realize.

Many ICU beds are at full capacity.

While we begin administering these #CovidVaccines, we must remember that no matter what, the tried and true public health practices, will keep us safe as we await the widespread distribution of #CovidVaccinations

Wear a mask
Wash your hands
Watch your distance
Get your flu shot

Having a vaccine is only the first step. Ensuring that all Americans have an equitable opportunity to receive the #covidvacccine and promoting vaccine confidence will be the key towards achieving degrees of herd immunity and ensuring protection of Americans against #COVID19

Meeting with Commissioner Allison Arwady, @ChiPublicHealth, @IDPH Director Dr Ngozi Ezike, and Chicago Healthcare leaders about vaccines and distribution. #Covidvaccine are being delivered to every hospital in Chicago to save lives and bring hope to residents. https://t.co/Im7Hai1jrE

I want to give a shout-out to Luis, a nurse, who just got his #CovidVaccine recently.

Thank you for leading by example! https://t.co/6yj0mfmmq2

@FrankBuckleyTV @KingJames It would be great to see @KingJames promote vaccinations in general (hopefully he ‚Äútook the (flu) shot‚Äù this year).  But like everyone else, I just hope while waiting his turn to be offered a #COVID19 vax, he‚Äôs getting the facts to make an informed decision. That‚Äôs all I ask!

If you have recovered from #COVID19, confirmed by a positive test, you‚Äôre in a special position to help us fight the virus. 

This holiday season, donate your plasma and give a vital lifesaving gift to your community.

Find a plasma donation center at: https://t.co/l4OhxX14ok https://t.co/fGCtfzhO3F

I also want to thank @margbrennan for asking me about the reasons for distrust in minority communities and giving me a chance to explain that public health is about everyone ‚Äì documented or undocumented. The more people protected from this virus the quicker we end this pandemic!

I have complete faith in the process by which the #COVID19 vaccines were developed, the protections in place to ensure safety, and the many people of color (from scientists to reviewers to study participants) who were involved throughout. That‚Äôs #whyIvax https://t.co/iAjC0eh70j

In #Columbus Ohio, speaking with @GovMikeDeWine, state representatives, and community leaders about #COVID19 and the importance of vaccinations - when gatekeepers are confident and informed, community members are confident and informed.

@baseballmom524 Most ICUs don‚Äôt run half empty- it‚Äôs not a sustainable business model. So even at 25% Covid cases they can still run out of ICU capacity - and someone who was in a car wreck or has a heart attack no longer can get care. If you can prevent this by simply wearing a mask, why not?
